Name: Yesno
Summary: Sixty recordings of one individual saying yes or no in Hebrew; each recording is eight words long.

Summary: A mirror of the OpenFst toolkit

Summary: A mirror of the sph2pipe software

Name: sctk
Summary: A mirror of the sctk scoring software

Summary: A mirror of the Mississippi State transcripts and lexicon for Switchboard.

Summary: English and Czech data, mirrored from the Vystadial project

Summary: English speech recognition training corpus from TED talks, created by Laboratoire d’Informatique de l’Université du Maine (LIUM) (mirrored here)

Name: Sprakbanken
Summary: Danish pronunciation dictionary generated using eSpeak

Name: The AMI pack
Summary: Some auxiliary non-speech data used to build AMI systems with Kaldi

Summary: Various files from SRE data that NIST used to host online

Name: The AMI Corpus
Summary: Acoustic speech data and meta-data from The AMI corpus.

Name: MUSAN
Summary: A corpus of music, speech, and noise

Summary: Aachen Impulse Response database (AIR): a database of room impulse responses (mirrored here)

Name: Simulated Room Impulse Response Database

Name: Cantab-TEDLIUM Release 1.1 (February 2015)

Name: Room Impulse Response and Noise Database
Summary: A database of simulated and real room impulse responses, isotropic and point-source noises. The audio files in this data are all in 16k sampling rate and 16-bit precision.

Summary: Swedish pronunciation dictionary

Summary: Multi-speaker TTS data for four South African languages, Afrikaans, Sesotho, Setswana and isiXhosa.

Summary: This dataset is based on LibriVox audiobooks

Name: Deeply Korean read speech corpus
Summary: Pairs of Korean reading the scripts with 3 text sentiments using 3 vocal sentiments. Recorded in 3 types of places, at 3 distinct distances, with 2 types of smartphone.

Summary: The interaction of pairs of parent and child(reading fairy tales, singing children’s songs, conversing, and others).Recorded in 3 types of places, at 3 distinct distances, with 2 types of smartphone.

Name: Deeply Nonverbal Vocalization Dataset
Summary: A human nonverbal vocal sound dataset by Deeply Inc.

Name: Multilingual TEDx
Summary: a multilingual corpus of TEDx talks for speech recognition and translation

Name: speechocean762
Summary: Pronunciation scoring dataset, labeled independently by five human experts

Summary: A crowdsourced open-source Kazakh speech corpus developed by ISSAI (330 hours)
